name: Conflict to cartoons
description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

end.title: Josie and the Pussycats

end.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2001
end.brief_description: Josie, Melody and Val are three small-town girl musicians determined to take their rock band out of their garage and straight to the top, while remaining true to their look, style and sound.

links.description: The period musical comedy follows a band propelled to stardom following a hit song, which is also the title of the film â€“ That Thing You Do (1996). The track was nominated for an Oscar and penned by Adam Schlesinger, who was also behind the music for Josie and the Pussycats (2001).

links.description: A commercial and critical flop at the time, Josie and the Pussycats (2001) went on to become a cult classic in the decades following its release. It was based on the Archie comic book of the same name, which was also the basis for the 70s cartoon series.

links.description: Arriving just on the other side of the Civil Rights movement in America, Hanna-Barberaâ€™s Josie and The Pussycats (1970â€“71) animated series featured the first black character on a Saturday morning cartoon ever â€“ Valerie. The original songs were made by the same team behind the hits on The Partridge Family (1970â€“75).

start.title: Band of Brothers
start.creator_credit: Erik Bork, Erik Jendresen, Gary Goetzman, Stephen Ambrose, Tony To, BBC Television Centre, DreamWorks Pictures, DreamWorks Television, HBO, HBO Films and Playtone
start.brief_description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war.

links.description: Considered one of the greatest mini-series ever made, Band of Brothers (2001) followed the real-life exploits of Easy Company during WWII. Tom Hanks directed one of the pivotal episodes of the series after making his directorial debut with That Thing You Do (1996).

start.title: Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR

end.title: Band of Brothers
end.creator_credit: Erik Bork, Erik Jendresen, Gary Goetzman, Stephen Ambrose, Tony To, BBC Television Centre, DreamWorks Pictures, DreamWorks Television, HBO, HBO Films and Playtone
end.brief_description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

links.description: Due to its lightweight and dependable nature, this model of camera was standard issue for combat photographers embedded with troops during various conflicts such as WWII. Replicas are depicted being carried in the background of Band of Brothers (2001) for this reason.
